articles.author: Amarachi Orie
articles.title: Cannibalism was a common funeral ritual in Europe 15,000 years ago, study finds - CNN
articles.description: Cannibalism was a routine funerary practice in Europe about 15,000 years ago, with people eating their dead not out of necessity but rather as part of their culture, according to a new study.
articles.content:
Cannibalism was a routine funerary practice in Europe about 15,000 years ago, with people eating their dead not out of necessity but rather as part of their culture, according to a new study.

articles.title: Earth is on track for its hottest year yet, according to a European climate agency - NPR
articles.description: The report from the Copernicus Climate Change Service also noted that Earth set a new mark for how far above normal temperatures reached in September.
articles.content: A person rests under an umbrella as the sun sets, Sept. 12, 2023, in Newport Beach, Calif. After a summer of record-smashing heat, warming somehow got even worse in September as Earth set a new mark … [+3339 chars]
